attributes.action: Change laws for British citizenship so they refer to ‘parent’ not ‘father’.
attributes.background:
The right to British citizenship depends on a number factors but sometimes, just the father.

An example is seen here: https://www.gov.uk/register-british-citizen/born-before-2006-british-father.

There is no need for gender at all.

attributes.action: To made possible to claim disability discrimination when applying for a school.
attributes.background: Currently, the law prevents to make an appeal on disability discrimination case against Local Authority when they fail to secure a place at chosen school. The decision is made by Local Authority and SEND Tribunal can only act aginst schools.
attributes.additional_details: Under Schedule 17 of the Equality Act, 2010 Tribunal Special Educational Needs and Disability only has the power to consider a claim against the responsible body for school and cannot consider a claim against the local authority for the exercise of powers to determine the admission. The decision about child admission is made by local authority only and if the process is not correct parents cannot pursuit claim of disability discrimination against the local authority.

attributes.action: Scrap the OISC and extend the remit of the SRA to Immigration Advisers
attributes.background: The Office of Immigration Services Commissioner (OISC) is sponsored by the Home Office and regulates immigration advisers, professionals that do an important job and many are more specialised than solicitors. I believe the OISC operates in a secretive, undemocratic, biased and unfair manner.
attributes.additional_details:
It's powers are hardly challenged as it has many powers.

The fact this body quietly operates with professionals that do not have much legal knowledge can leave professionals open to unfair treatment. Surprisingly they almost always win cases in court. This cannot be right. The Home Office itself with much more infrastructure does not have this level of precision.

attributes.action: Give tax breaks to parents who support their children through university
attributes.background:
I am supporting my daughter through university. 
Why not treat these payments in the same way as gift aid? , reimburse my daughter the 20% tax on the value that I've paid to her?

attributes.action: Require online retailers and platforms to disclose courier before order placed
attributes.background: When ordering goods online, websites generally do not state which courier service they will use for delivery. However, several courier companies have a track record of poor customer service and losing/damaging parcels. If consumers know which courier will be used, they can choose not to order.
attributes.additional_details: For an example, view the "tweets and replies" at @myhermes

attributes.action: Abolish business rates and replace with business rates transaction charge
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  These disproportionate business rates are contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% business rates charge levied on the sales value of each transaction would be a fair arrangement and would be linked directly to the success of a retail business. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place.  The credit card holder’s physical location or credit card address is readily available for government’s re-distribution to the local authorities.
